newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Tietmeyer sees G10 inflation under control.
newsitem.headline: Tietmeyer sees G10 inflation under control.

text.p: Bundesbank president Hans Tietmeyer said inflation was under control in practially all of the Group of 10 countries, and monetary policy in these countries was also appropriate.
Speaking as the chairman of the G10 central bank governors committee, he added that inflation was never dead and could resurface, so monetary policy had to remain vigilant.
He said this was the case "in some countries more than in others, because of different growth rates."
He made his comments to reporters after the G10 meeting at the Bank for International Settlements (BIS).
"All in all, inflation seems to be in practically all countries under control, and monetary policy seems to be in most countries appropriate," Tietmeyer said.
